Content:
Hi all,
I have a Nolan N87 helmet which comes with an internal visor but I never end up using it as I find the glare is almost worse when I have it down. I thought a good solution for this would be a polarised visor, but I can't seem to find much information about them - especially one that would work as an internal visor for my specific helmet.

Is there a reason there doesn't seem to be a huge market for them? It seems like most people just opt to wear polarised sunglasses under their helmets, but I have to wear prescription glasses already and don't own prescription sunglasses.
Title: Polarised Sun Visors?
Author: Rachel C
